examples: she sat in an armchair, absorbed in a book

definitions.definition: take in or soak up (energy, or a liquid or other substance) by chemical or physical action, typically gradually.
examples: buildings can be designed to absorb and retain heat
synonyms: sop up "a spongelike material that absorbs water"

definitions.definition: take in and assimilate (information, ideas, or experience).
examples: she absorbed the information in silence
synonyms: take in "she absorbed the information in silence"

definitions.definition: take control of (a smaller or less powerful entity), making it a part of oneself by assimilation.
examples: the family firm was absorbed into a larger group
synonyms: swallow up "the company was absorbed into the new concern"

definitions.definition: use or take up (time or resources).
examples: arms spending absorbs roughly 2 percent of the national income
synonyms: occupy "these roles absorb most of his time and energy"

definitions.definition: take up and reduce the effect or intensity of (sound or an impact).
examples: deep-pile carpets absorbed all sound of the outside world
the work absorbed him and continued to make him happy
synonyms: fascinate by/with "she was totally absorbed in her book"
